overview: This subject is designed for construction law students without prior legal training (Construction Lawis for students who have a law degree). It provides an overview of the broad spread of the construction law curriculum, from the statutory and common law landscape through legal aspects of project procurement and contracting to dispute avoidance and resolution options. This subject also provides detailed treatment of legal issues specific to construction law such as variations, quality, time and payment. The seminar format is supplemented by exercises to develop students’ skills in contract preparation and writing legal hypotheticals, and includes sessions on construction law research tools and techniques.
Overview of the regulatory regime for construction contracting
Causes of action in construction disputes
Contract administration: standard forms of contract, tendering, contract preparation and minimising legal exposure
Contractual mechanisms for payment and security of payment legislation
Dispute avoidance procedures and alternative dispute resolution
Construction litigation and arbitration (domestic and international).

additional pre-requisite: Admission into a relevant Melbourne Law Masters program
